title: Phil Bauhaus sprints to victory on stage 1 of the Tour of Poland
content:
Phil Bauhaus (Bahrain Victorious) nabbed the opening stage of the Tour of Poland on Monday in Chełm.

The 216.4 km stage 1 from Lublin came down to a sprint in a cobbled, slightly uphill finale, where Álvaro Hodeg (Deceuninck-QuickStep) was the first big contender to launch with some 300 meters still to go. The 24-year-old Colombian jumped out to a big gap at first, but Bauhaus wound up to speed behind him and then came surging past in the closing meters to take the win, his sixth pro victory so far in 2021.

Hodeg settled for second with Hugo Hofstetter (Israel Start-Up Nation) taking third on the day. Bauhaus will take a four-second GC lead into Tuesday’s stage 2.

Tour de Pologne (2.UWT) Lublin → Chełm
author: Dane Cash
